subject: RE: [junit] assertEquals NullPointerException
msgSnippet: You didn t initialize the member variables in setUp().  Instead you created two local variables and initialized them (but these can t be seen outside of
messageBody:
You didn't initialize the member variables in setUp(). Instead you created
two local variables and initialized them (but these can't be seen outside of
setUp()). The member variables are both initialized to null, by default, so
when you do a.plus(b) you are attempting to invoke the plus() method on a
null.

Scott Stirling

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Ro <rrt24@...> [mailto:rrt24@...]
>
> I have a class "Complex" representing complex numbers, and i have a
> class "ComplexTest" testing them. i get a NullPointerException at the
> following peice of code in my test class:
>
> *****************
> public class ComplexTest extends TestCase {
>
> private Complex a;
> private Complex b;
>
> // private Complex d;
>
> protected void setUp() {
> Complex a = new Complex(1.0,2.0);
> Complex b = new Complex(2.0,3.0);
>
>
> }
>
> public void testAdd() {
>
> Complex d = new Complex(3.0,5.0);
> assertEquals(d,a.plus(b)); //EXCEPTION BROUGHT UP HERE!
> }
>
>
> public static void main (String args [])
> {
> junit.textui.TestRunner.run(ComplexTest.class);
> }
>
> }
> **********************
